# unix2date
convert unixtime included in STDIN to datetime and output.

1. build

```
go build -o unix2date main.go
```

2. execute

```
% cat << EOS | ./unix2date
2 123456789010 eni-1235b8ca123456789 172.31.16.139 172.31.16.21 20641 22 6 20 4249 1496405335 1496403935 ACCEPT OK
2 123456789010 eni-1235b8ca123456789 172.31.9.69 172.31.9.12 49761 3389 6 20 4249 1718530010 1718530070 REJECT OK
EOS
2 123456789010 eni-1235b8ca123456789 172.31.16.139 172.31.16.21 20641 22 6 20 4249 1496405335 1496403935 ACCEPT OK
2 123456789010 eni-1235b8ca123456789 172.31.9.69 172.31.9.12 49761 3389 6 20 4249 2024-06-16T09:26:50Z 2024-06-16T09:27:50Z REJECT OK
```

3. execute with the period past 10 years

```
% cat << EOS | ./unix2date -days-ago 3650
2 123456789010 eni-1235b8ca123456789 172.31.16.139 172.31.16.21 20641 22 6 20 4249 1496405335 1496403935 ACCEPT OK
2 123456789010 eni-1235b8ca123456789 172.31.9.69 172.31.9.12 49761 3389 6 20 4249 1718530010 1718530070 REJECT OK
EOS
2 123456789010 eni-1235b8ca123456789 172.31.16.139 172.31.16.21 20641 22 6 20 4249 2017-06-02T12:08:55Z 2017-06-02T11:45:35Z ACCEPT OK
2 123456789010 eni-1235b8ca123456789 172.31.9.69 172.31.9.12 49761 3389 6 20 4249 2024-06-16T09:26:50Z 2024-06-16T09:27:50Z REJECT OK
```
